thread.title: Cards catcher Molina will try to play with splint over thumb
thread.title_full: Cards catcher Molina will try to play with splint over thumb

author: R.B. FALLSTROM
title: Cards catcher Molina will try to play with splint over thumb
text:
Gene J. Puskar Cards catcher Molina will try to play with splint over thumb 
Injured St. Louis Cardinals catcher Yadier Molina, left, talks to starting pitcher Adam Wainwright in the dugout before a baseball game against the Pittsburgh Pirates in Pittsburgh, Wednesday, Sept. 30, 2015. (AP Photo/Gene J. Puskar) Posted: Monday, October 5, 2015 3:30 pm | Updated: 5:04 pm, Mon Oct 5, 2015. Cards catcher Molina will try to play with splint over thumb Associated Press | 
ST. LOUIS (AP) — St. Louis Cardinals catcher Yadier Molina will try to play in the NL Division Series while wearing a splint to protect his injured left thumb. 
The All-Star, widely considered the best defensive catcher in the game, met with a hand specialist on Monday. Subscription Required An online service is needed to view this article in its entirety.
